title: Production release: Deploy Draft Version 36 (frontend-only plan)

requirements.summary: Prepare the frontend release artifact and deployment notes for promoting Draft Version 36 to production without code changes.
acceptanceCriteria: A production deployment is performed using the current codebase corresponding to Draft Version 36.
The canister upgrade completes successfully (no traps during preupgrade/postupgrade, if applicable).
The production frontend loads and connects to the production backend canister successfully.

file_operations.description: Add a production deployment checklist focused on frontend release steps only (build, environment variable verification, canister IDs wiring expectations, and post-deploy verification that the SPA loads). Include a note that no feature/code changes are to be made for Draft Version 36; this file is documentation only.

Document the required production environment variables as consumed by the current frontend (e.g., II_* and CANISTER_* variables used by the existing configuration and Vite environment injection) and how to confirm they are correctly set during deployment.

requirements.summary: Add a repeatable frontend smoke-test checklist for Internet Identity login/logout and user profile persistence across refresh/relogin.
acceptanceCriteria: A user can sign in via Internet Identity and reach protected routes (e.g., Dashboard).
A user can update their profile and the changes persist after a full page refresh.
A user can log out and log back in and still see their persisted profile data.
No new runtime errors are observed in the UI during the smoke test.

file_operations.description: Create a concise smoke-test script that explicitly validates: (1) Internet Identity sign-in from the Sign In page, (2) protected-route access via the AuthGate flow (e.g., Dashboard/Profile), (3) profile save and persistence after full refresh, (4) logout clears cached data and re-login still retrieves persisted profile. Reference the appâ€™s existing authentication/profile flow (authorization component patterns via useInternetIdentity, useActor, and useGetCallerUserProfile). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
